content: OpenClaw, an open-source agent framework, does not have built-in memory like ChatGPT or Claude, requiring users to build their own memory system.
To build an effective memory system for an OpenClaw agent, define exactly what it remembers, where it's stored, how it's organized, and who can access it.
An 'AI employee' is an AI that knows your business, remembers decisions, learns from mistakes, and avoids repeating them, in contrast to an 'AI assistant' which merely answers questions.
To enable an AI to function as an 'AI employee', provide it with 5 plain text files (SOUL.md, IDENTITY.md, USER.md, TOOLS.md, MEMORY.md) that it reads at the start of every session.
Create a SOUL.md file to define an AI's personality, voice, and boundaries, acting as its 'operating manual' for how it thinks and communicates.
The 'NOT' section in SOUL.md, detailing behaviors the AI should avoid, is more critical than the 'IS' section for correcting annoying behaviors over time.
Include security boundaries in SOUL.md, such as only trusting verified messaging channels and confirming email instructions, to ensure the AI knows what actions not to take.
Create an IDENTITY.md file to give the AI a name, title, and clear role, as a defined role helps the AI make better judgment calls.
To enable an AI agent to process TikTok videos, build a pipeline using `yt-dlp` to download the video, `ffmpeg` to extract audio, and `Whisper` for transcription.

Develop a USER.md file to provide the AI with context about the user, including their communication style, priorities, and what annoys them, preventing the AI from defaulting to a generic assistant mode.
Writing a rule once to fix a recurring problem saves significant time compared to repeatedly correcting the issue.
Instruct AI agents to check a `TOOLS.md` file before stating an inability to perform a task, as credentials or workarounds might be documented there.
`MEMORY.md` serves as an AI's long-term understanding of a user's operations, preferences, and decisions, distinct from general world facts.
An AI agent can automatically build institutional knowledge by reviewing conversations, extracting relevant information, and updating `MEMORY.md`.

Within three months, an AI maintaining its own `MEMORY.md` will accumulate more operational context than most human employees learn in their first year, and it will retain this knowledge indefinitely.
To prevent AI agents from forgetting past corrections, document every mistake and its fix in `AGENTS.md` rather than relying on the agent's 'mental notes'.

Implement a `Repo Hygiene` rule for AI coding agents to always clone repositories to `/tmp/`, delete clones after pushing and creating a PR, and use canonical paths for existing copies, to prevent clutter.
Instruct AI agents to use `tmux` for long-running processes instead of running them as background processes, ensuring they survive system restarts.
The instruction "figure it out" is more valuable for training an AI than detailed instructions, as it teaches problem-solving rather than just providing answers.
Document exact correct CLI syntax and explicitly list wrong or forbidden flags in `AGENTS.md` to prevent AI coding agents from using incorrect command flags.
Any time a user thinks "I told you this before" to an AI, it signals a need to add that information as a permanent rule in `AGENTS.md`.
Skills are plug-and-play instruction sets, typically markdown files, that teach an AI agent specific abilities and are loaded only when needed for a task.

An AI agent's configuration can be structured into several files: SOUL.md (personality and rules), IDENTITY.md (name and role), USER.md (user's preferences), TOOLS.md (accessible tools), MEMORY.md (long-term brain), and AGENTS.md (correction loop for mistakes).
To quickly create an AI agent you like, start by writing its SOUL.md file tonight, focusing on what annoys you and giving it a name.

To generate initial configuration files for an AI employee, use a prompt that instructs an AI (like Claude) to act as an 'AI employee onboarding specialist' and interview you to gather information for SOUL.md, IDENTITY.md, USER.md, TOOLS.md, and MEMORY.md.
Using an AI to interview you for configuration files can produce the necessary files in approximately 10 minutes.
